bug.author: MarcSkovMadsen
bug.summary: Errors in and updates to Contributing file
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I'm trying to follow the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/wiki/Contributing#ubuntu>Contributing guide for Ubuntu</denchmark-link> on <denchmark-link:https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/services/visual-studio-online/>Visual Studio Online</denchmark-link> . I get some errors as I try to get up and running. The errors are reported below. You can follow my installation steps at <denchmark-link:https://awesome-streamlit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/vscode.html#installing-the-streamlit-repo-for-development-using-visual-studio-online>https://awesome-streamlit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/vscode.html#installing-the-streamlit-repo-for-development-using-visual-studio-online</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h2>Error : python3-distutils</denchmark-h>
When running the command sudo apt install graphviz python3-distutils i get the error E: Package 'python3-distutils' has no installation candidate <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42288570/68539929-b4af9f00-038a-11ea-824d-b98a427373eb.png></denchmark-link>
My guess is that i'ts because the Visual Studio Online container is running Debian. <denchmark-h:h3>Solution</denchmark-h>
Add a section for Debian and change python3-distutils to libpython3.7-stdlib I have tried it. And it worked 1 out of 2 times I tried it. <denchmark-h:h2>Error: git checkout develop</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42288570/68540052-263c1d00-038c-11ea-95cb-a53a9337e8a9.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Solution</denchmark-h>
Remove the git checkout develop line from the Contributing file as it's not needed. <denchmark-h:h3>Error: pipenv install --dev fails.</denchmark-h>
The cause is that installing tensorflow using pipenv is not supported. See for example <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pypa/pipenv/issues/2619>pypa/pipenv#2619</denchmark-link> . (lib) vsonline:~/workspace/streamlit$ make all-devel pip install pip-tools pipenv ; \ if [[ 3.8.0 == "3.6.0" || 3.8.0 > "3.6.0" ]] ; then \ pip install black ; \ fi Collecting pip-tools Downloading 2.7 only. ---------------------------------------- ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1: python setup.py egg_info Check the logs for full command output. (lib) vsonline:~/workspace/streamlit/lib$ Then (lib) vsonline:~/workspace/streamlit/lib$ python Python 3.8.0 (default, Oct 25 2019, 17:01:36) [GCC 6.3.0 20170516] on linux Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> exit Use exit() or Ctrl-D (i.e. EOF) to exit >>> exit() I tried using pyenv to create a python 3.7.4 based environment. After a lot of hassles I got it working but I still got the error message above when trying to pipenv install things. I then i removed tensorflow from the Pipfile <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42288570/68540704-a10a3580-0396-11ea-988a-a4cd7ced138a.png></denchmark-link>
manually installed tensorflow using pip install tensorflow And the make all-devel succeeded. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42288570/68540748-3f969680-0397-11ea-81c4-92ab22f0e065.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional Context</denchmark-h>
I would like to start exploring and maybe contributing to the streamlit repo. But i'm on Windows 8.1. I tried to see if it was at all possible to get up and running on Windows. And it's not as far as I can see. There are simple too many dependencies on Linux in the Makefile. Then I thought. Can I use the <denchmark-link:https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/remote/containers>Visual Studio Code Remote - Containers</denchmark-link> . Nope it requires Windows 10 and Docker (not Docker Toolbox). Finally I thought lets try out the new online experience of Visual Studio Online in VS Code using the <denchmark-link:https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=MS-vsonline.vsonline>Visual Studio Online VS Code extension</denchmark-link> . After the hassles above I can build and run things

comments.comment: In the end I got it working and announced it here <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/new-guide-how-to-contribute-to-the-streamlit-from-windows-using-visual-studio-online/966>https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/new-guide-how-to-contribute-to-the-streamlit-from-windows-using-visual-studio-online/966</denchmark-link>
